turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Northern Ireland national football team.
turn.1: Who was the manager of the Northern Ireland national football team?
turn.2: Billy Bingham, a member of the 1958 squad, was manager for both of these tournaments.
turn.3: Did the team ever go to the world cup?
turn.4: They have not qualified for any other World Cups since.
turn.5: Who else has managed the team?
turn.6: Lawrie Sanchez was appointed in January 2004 after a run of ten games without a goal under the previous manager Sammy McIlroy, which was a European record for any international team until San Marino went over 20 games without scoring between October 2008 and August 2012.
turn.7: How did the team do when Lawrie was in charge?
turn.8: That run ended after his first game in charge, a 1–4 loss to Norway in a friendly in February 2004.
turn.10: The run of 16 games without a win ended after his second game, a 1–0 victory in a friendly over Estonia, with a largely experimental side, in March 2004.
turn.11: What other wins did they have?
turn.12: On 7 September 2005, Northern Ireland beat England 1–0 in a 2006 World Cup qualifier at Windsor Park. David Healy scored the winner in the 73rd minute.
